<span style="color: blue; ">
    
# What I can understand is that
# * Considering the heatmap of correlation between 'Class' and other features, I could not find any 'strong correlation' between 'Class' and other features.
# * But Class D, lowest grade in performance, has some special features. Average of 'age', 'weight' and 'body fat %' are highest in Classes. Average 'gripforce', 'sit and bend forward cm', 'sit ups counts' and 'broad jump cm' are lowest in classes.
# * It means that as we are getting older, in many cases, by hypometabolism, we are getting fat, and hypanakinesis. Actually I can find 'stong negative correlation' between 'body fat %' and physical abilities,for example 'gripforce', 'sit ups counts' and 'broad jump cm'
# * In the classification model, 'sit and bend forward cm' and 'sit ups counts' are most importnt and second important to classfy. But in Class D, 'weight' and 'body fat %' are critical factor to classify.
# 
# Important thing is that how we can manage the weight and body fat, and keep physical ability as we are getting older, although we may have to stay home  again when we have another pandemic or any disasters.
